attributes.action: Introduce the Hunting Act into Northern Ireland law.
attributes.background: In 2005, the Hunting Act was introduced into law, but is only applicable to England and Wales. It bans the hunting of wild mammals (notably foxes, deer, hares and mink) with dogs. In Northern Ireland there is no such law.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for. 

If you'd like to send your petition to the Northern Ireland Assembly, you can find the contact details here:
http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/about-the-assembly/contact-us/
